page.title: 07Harpenden High St. Shopping
page.content: Wood End pupils sent questionnaires to parents in 3 schools and interviewed shoppers in the High St.. We found that the High St. is a friendly meeting place where food shops are considered satisfactory by most. People liked the 3 major supermarkets but regretted the closure of the 'corner shop'. Location & ease of parking affected the choice of supermarket. Nearby larger shopping centres, with department stores & markets, made housewives think Harpenden clothes shops expensive & limited. Many didn't know why Anscombes (haberdashers) and Woolworths had to close & would like a department store in Harpenden. Those who had lived in Harpenden for 20 years or more liked the changes least; most did not realise that high rates & rent have caused small shops to close.
